resources.string: Rethink uses the accessibility service to detect and firewall background apps.
Rethink lets you monitor your network activity, bypass Internet censorship, and firewall apps.
Rethink is software you can use, study, change and share.

string.name: warning_title
string.description: Status indicator text shown in a warning notification.

string.name: notification_content
string.description: Indicates what will happen if the user taps the notification.

resources.string: Protected. Connected to fast and secure DNS.
Protected. Connected to DNS and firewall.

string.name: status_waiting
string.description: This text appears during the connection process if Intra needs user permission or the device is offline.

string.name: status_failing
string.description: This text appears if the connection is currently not working correctly. [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]

string.name: status_protected
string.description: This is a large message in a reassuring color. It indicates DNS queries can't be surveilled or modified in transit.

resources.string: Protected with Tor and private DNS
Protected with proxy and private DNS
Protected with SOCKS5 and private DNS
Protected with HTTP(S) proxy and private DNS

string.name: status_strict
string.description: Similar to dns_on, but the protection is provided by Android, not by Rethink. It is not color-highlighted.

string.name: status_exposed
string.description: This is a large message in a scary color. It indicates DNS queries can be surveilled or modified in transit.

string.name: dns_explanation_connected
string.description: The message will be shown when the DNS is connected

resources.string: Apply firewall rules for all apps based on device events, e.g. when the device is locked or when a particular app is not in use.
Monitor network activity and firewall any app or IP.
Monitor, block, and encrypt DNS requests.
The accessibility service distinguishes between apps in active use (foreground) and not (background).

The Rethink accessibility service stopped or crashed. Open the settings and force-stop Rethink and start it again to use Block any app not in use.\n\nRethink uses the accessibility service to track which apps are in use (foreground) and not (background).
Could not open the accessibility settings. Try again later.
Delete your DNS logs for good!?

<u>#1</u>: Blocks an app from connecting to the Internet. 
 <u>#2</u>: Blocks any app from connecting to a particular IP. 
 <u>#3</u>: Blocks all connections when device locked (universal firewall). 
 <u>#4</u>: Blocks any app not in use (universal firewall). 
 <u>#5</u>: Blocks connections when source app unknown (universal firewall). 
 <u>#6</u>: Blocks all UDP traffic except DNS (universal firewall). 
 <u>#7</u>: Block connections when DNS is bypassed (universal firewall).
Turn off \"Always-on VPN\" in the Android settings to start Rethink.
Stop Rethink even though it uses always-on VPN in Android?
Stop Rethink when the VPN is in lockdown (disconnecting you from the Internet)?
Continue deleting this rule (allowing any app to connect to this IP)?
No IPs found. Tap on entries in the \"Network Log\" screen to block individual IPs.
Delete the DNS-over-HTTPS endpoint from your setup.
Delete the DNSCrypt resolver from saved configuration.
Delete the DNSCrypt relay from saved configuration.
Delete the DNS proxy from saved configuration.
Download blocklists (around 60 MB) to use this feature?
Something went wrong. Try again later.
Turn on logging again from Settings ‚Üí Logging.
Turn on DNS-request again from Settings ‚Üí Logging.

HTTP(S) proxy settings are only a hint to apps but they may or may not use it; however, browsers like Chrome and Firefox do use these. Apps using HTTP(S) proxy will bypass both firewall and DNS rules.
Download it now from the website?
You are already on the latest version of Rethink.
Either the Rethink servers are down or a connection could not be established. Try again later.
Could not install the new version. Try again later.
Copied as URL to Rethink DNS+ DNS-over-HTTPS
Log DNS and firewall info to the device.

Maximum effort

1. Introducing a more private Rethink resolver, Max.
2. Mark IPv6 as experimental; switch to IPv4 by default.
3. New feature: Backup and restore app settings.
4. New feature: App lockdown mode.
5. New feature: Universal lockdown mode.
6. New feature: Apply firewall rules on port numbers.
7. New feature: Apply app firewall rules in batches.
8. Minor UI refresh.
9. Other memory and crash fixes.

Help translate this app
Translate outbound IPv6 traffic to IPv4 on the device. Use if connected to an IPv4-only network.
Allow apps to bypass the Rethink firewall on-demand. Audio/video chat apps may require this.
Cannot bypass or set up proxies when the VPN is in lockdown. Go to VPN settings.
May be ignored by apps, as those using a HTTP(S) proxy bypass both firewall and DNS rules.
Forwards all TCP connections to Orbot.
Recommends apps use Orbot\'s HTTP(S) proxy.
HTTP(S) proxy set. (Apps may ignore it.)
Forwarding %1$s to Orbot. HTTP(S) proxy also set.
Could not launch Orbot. Is it installed?
Rethink has stopped forwarding connections to Orbot, but Orbot may be running in the background.
Rethink now forwards DNS queries to Orbot. Change as required.

Orbot is proxy app letting apps use the Internet more securely. \nOrbot uses Tor to encrypt your Internet traffic, to bypass censorship and defend against network surveillance. \nTCP proxy: Rethink forwards only TCP connections of all apps (that are not excluded) to Orbot. \nHTTP(S) proxy: Rethink sets a HTTP(S) proxy, but does not require apps to use it. Usually, browsers like Chrome and Firefox do use it. Apps using a HTTP(S) proxy will bypass both Firewall and DNS rules.
This allows using the Tor network.
Something went wrong. Try after later.
Orbot in non-VPN mode with HTTPS/SOCKS5.
Connected to Orbot. Turn it off to continue.
Turn off HTTP(S) and/or SOCKS5 proxy to continue with Tor-as-a-proxy setup.
Connected to Orbot. Turn it off to continue.
Could not start Tor as a proxy. Open the Orbot app to start it manually.
Start up Rethink with the device if it was running when it was shut off or restarted.
Uses all available networks to connect to the Internet instead of only the active one in Android.
Continue and ignore app firewall rules for metered (mobile) and non-metered (Wi-Fi)?
Looks for new versions of the app once a week.
Manually back up or restore the Rethink app data and settings.
Enable notification permission for the app
Could not connect to host. Try again.
The selected app will be excluded from the VPN to let it proxy connections on your behalf.
\nPause and Stop (default)\nTo quickly pause and stop Rethink.
\nDNS and DNS and Firewall\nTo switch between the battery-saving DNS, and the regular DNS and firewall.
Switch to DNS, or DNS and firewall to turn this on.

Grant Rethink permission to set up a local VPN to encrypt the device\'s DNS requests, implement a network monitor, and enforce firewall rules. \n\nRethink does not collect any info or spy on you in any way.
Either you have not granted VPN permission, or another app is using Always-on VPN.
Enable notification permission from Settings screen
You can browse network activity, block websites, IPs, and badly behaving apps.
Excluding is not possible when the VPN is in lockdown
Cannot pause Rethink when it is in lockdown
Choose from 185+ blocklists.\nClick here to download or set them up.
Use around 350 MB for website icons (from duckduckgo.com).
Captures all packets on port 53 and forwards them to a user-set DNS endpoint.
Rethink lets you monitor app activity, circumvent Internet censorship, and firewall apps.
It is libre software, led by ex-engineers from IBM, Amazon, and Scientific Games.
Could not fetch crash logs.\nReport a bug manually?
Look for new versions of the app
Could not find any crash reports.
Could not show the app-notification screen.
Install a web browser to open the website.
Could not find any crash reports.

The Rethink Project owes its existence to volunteers devoting countless hours to its development.

Rules applied for %1$s also apply to %2$s other apps
Block all apps when the device is locked
Block any app not in use
Block when source app is unknown
Block UDP except DNS and NTP
Block newly installed apps by default
Block all except bypassed apps and IPs
Modify blocked or bypassed IP / port rules.
Deleting these rules would allow any app to connect to the currently blocked IPs.
Atleast one resolver should be selected.

Block apps from connecting to the Internet. Limiting access to the Internet helps prevent unwarranted data usage, as well as save battery.

Metered (Mobile) / Unmetered (Wi-Fi) firewall rules will not be honoured when:

1. VPN is in lockdown (i.e, Block connections without VPN is on).

2. All networks is on.
Block connections on Wi-Fi network for listed apps?
Allow connections on Wi-Fi network for listed apps?
Block connections on mobile network for listed apps?
Allow connections on mobile network for listed apps?
VPN in lockdown. The firewall will ignore metered / unmetered rules.
Use all networks is on. The firewall will ignore metered / unmetered rules.
Apply unmetered / metered rules for listed apps
Could not find any firewall rules
Could not connect to DNSCrypt server.
Could not connect to the server of the DNS proxy.
Excluding %1$s for %2$s in lockdown can cause Internet connectivity issues.
Cannot find out what DNS server you are connected to
Tap to start Rethink\'s accessibility service again so backgrounded apps can be blocked.
Rethink\'s accessibility service stopped or crashed. No longer blocking backgrounded apps.
Note: %1$s blocked apps will remain firewalled.
Cannot change mode with VPN in lockdown. Tap to edit VPN settings.
No firewall rules matched this connection.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app.

Go to the All Apps tab to change this.

This app made connection for the first time.

Go to Universal tab to change this.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app when trying to connect on unmetered network.

Go to the All Apps tab to change this.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app when trying to connect on metered network.

Go to the All Apps tab to change this.

A user-set universal firewall rule blocked this app when trying to connect on Metered (Mobile) network.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app connecting to other than bypassed IPs.

Go to the All Apps tab to change this.

A user-set firewall rule blocked the destination IP / Port.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

A user-set firewall rule blocked the destination IP.

Go to the App-specific firewall screen to change this.

This connection was allowed because the destination IP is set to bypass all app-specific rules.

Go to App-specific Firewall screen to change this.

This connection was allowed because the destination IP is set to bypass all universal firewall rules.

Go to IP rules in the Universal tab to change this.

This connection was firewalled because device was locked at the time.

To change this behaviour go to Universal tab.

This connection was firewalled because the source app was not in the foreground.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

This connection was firewalled because the source app could not be determined.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this UDP connection.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

This connection was blocked because the source app bypassed user-preferred DNS.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

This connection was allowed because the source app is set to bypass universal firewall rules.

Go to the App-specific Firewall screen to change this.

This DNS connection was proxied and forwarded to user-preferred DNS endpoint.

Turn off Prevent DNS leaks from DNS Configure screen to change this.
This connection was allowed because one-click Tor-as-a-proxy setup via Orbot was in progress.

This connection was blocked because it likely used insecure HTTP.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.

This connection was blocked because universal lockdown is set.

Go to the Universal tab to change this.
